sentences.text: '''General elections''' are provisionally scheduled to be held in Seychelles on 27 September 2025.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |title=Seychelles' government proposes fixed date of Sept. 27 for presidential and parliamentary elections in 2025 |url=http://www.seychellesnewsagency.com/articles/20576/Seychelles'+government+proposes+fixed+date+of+Sept.++for+presidential+and+parliamentary+elections+in+ |access-date=25 August 2024 |work=Seychelles News Agency}}</ref>

sentences.text: The president of Seychelles is elected using the two-round system; if no candidate receives a majority of the vote in the first round, a second round is held between the top two candidates.

references.text: <ref>{{citation|url=http://www.electionguide.org/elections/id/2883/|title=Republic of Seychelles: Election for President|website=IFES Election Guide}}</ref>

sentences.text: Members of the National Assembly (Seychelles)|National Assembly are elected by two methods; 26 (with a new constituency established in 2020) are elected from single-member constituencies using first-past-the-post voting, and up to a further ten are elected based on the percentage of votes received by each party; for each 10% of the total national vote received, a party gets one additional seat.
